IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The purpose of the corporation is to educate the public about Azorean maritime history and Azorean culture, and especially the skills and crafts related to Azorean whaling history and seamanship.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The purpose of the corporation is to educate the public about Azorean maritime history and Azorean culture, and especially the skills and crafts related to Azorean whaling history and seamanship.
IRS990.Desc: Scholarship awards issued to first time college students ($5,500). A total of 5 scholarships were given in 2022 (4 at $1,000 and 1 at $1,500). Other fundraising expenses for this program totaled $5,393 (scholarship fundraiser dinner).

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Maintaining and insuring 3 authentic Azorean whaleboats and 1 authentic Yankee whaleboat for community rowing and sailing programs, demonstrations, and international regattas.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: Other income was $128,100 in donations received for our Capital Campaign to construct a new boat house (Casa dos Botes). Architectural and site engineering design is underway to construct a new maritime cultural facility/building on land we own in New Bedford. This facility will contain boat workshop and storage space to enable proper care, maintenance and construction of our boats, as well as meeting and office space for our organization. The building once constructed is anticipated to also be used by a partner non-profit boating organization to further bolster community impact.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Fundraiser 1 - Scholarship dinner to raise funds specific for scholarship grants awarded by our organization. Income from sale of tickets to the sit down dinner and donated raffle prizes. Expenses are inclusive of food/venue costs (a catering facility). Fundraiser 2 - Sails of Portugal Wine Tasting to raise general operating funds for the organization, with a portion (typically 10%) that goes to the scholarship program. Income from sale of tickets to this cocktail-style standing event and donated auction prizes. Expenses are largely for rental of the facility with minimal expenses for food, as most of food and all the wine was donated by purveyors. Fundraiser 3 - Clamboil to raise general operating funds for the organization. Income from sale of tickets to this seated event and donated raffle prizes. Expenses are for food.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: Scholarship awards for first time college students (4 at $1,000 each and 1 at $1,500).

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Scholarship committee establishes an application each year that is distributed throughout the community to request applications by a due date (e.g., April 1). The committee then reviews all applications, determines which ones have met all requirements, and then ranks them by merit (academic, community volunteering, quality of required essay) and based on the best match for each scholarship. Once a student has been selected for each available scholarship by the committee, notice is given to the Board of Directors regarding the selections. Awardees are then notified of their selection and checks are then mailed to the individuals. A brief scholarship awards ceremony is held each summer for the selected students and a press release is distributed with information about the scholarship winners (e.g., graduating high school, anticipated university and program of interest).
Grants paid - $5,500 in scholarships were awarded to 1st time college students through a competitive application process.

Other expenses totaled $60,172 and are itemized as follows - $48,375 boat repairs/maintenance, $6,336 insurance, $116 trailer repairs, $276 boat supplies, $392 post office box fee, $808 advertising & marketing, $1,373 office supplies, $518 bank charges and fees, $550 regatta transportation, $1,116 property taxes & fees, and $312 other miscellaneous business expenses.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: There are 2 board members who have a family relationship with another board member. Donald Rei and Lisa Lemieux are long-time partners living together.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: There were 108 members as of the October 25, 2022 bi-annual meeting.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Directors are elected annually by the members at the October Bi-annual meeting. There are no qualifications for members, other than that they pay dues each year, with dues set by the Board of Directors. At any meeting of members a quorum for the transaction of business shall consist of a minimum of ten percent (10%) of the membership in good standing at the time of the meeting.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Directors, subject to any action at any time taken by the members of the corporation, shall have the entire charge, control and management of the corporation and its property and may exercise all or any of its powers. However, major decisions that affect significant assets of the organization are discussed and voted on by the members.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A copy of the 990 was provided to the President and current and past Treasurers for review prior to filing. The preparer (Sara Quintal) worked with the past Treasurer to confirm income and expense transaction details and balances for the filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Program Services -- Other services include $29,141 for labor for professional boat repairs (Joao Silva Tavares). Management & General Services -- $14,190 for contractors assisting with environmental documentation and site design of Taylor Street property (site of proposed maritime cultural facility/boat house).

Other Program Service expenses -- $26,019 for boat and trailer supplies and dock lease. Other Fundraising expenses -- $1,828 for gear/merchandise (i.e., inventory for sale) and $8,482 for venue rental and food. This does not include Scholarship fundraiser expenses (venue/food & grant awards) included in Program Service expenses.
Other cash not categorized in Quickbooks
